summary: This document is a subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to Jordana Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), commanding the production of documents related to the program and its claimants. It includes the subpoena form, instructions, and the full EVCP Protocol detailing the program's administration, eligibility, and claims process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in criminal case 20CR330 (AJN) who is requesting the subpoena through her attorney to obtain documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jordana Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The person to whom the subpoena is directed, responsible for administering the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and making final determinations on claims.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who requested the subpoena, from the firm Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C.

persons.name: Kenneth R. Feinberg
persons.context: Nationally recognized claims administration expert retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Camille S. Biros
persons.context: Nationally recognized claims administration expert retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: A nationally recognized sexual abuse expert, legal academic, and victims' rights advocate who may be consulted by the Program Administrator to inform about abuse dynamics and serve as a resource.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose estate established the compensation program for victims-survivors of his alleged sexual abuse.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of assisting Epstein in procuring victims for sexual abuse, as referenced in the EVCP protocol regarding eligibility of individuals who allegedly assisted Epstein.
Pagliuca is listed as the attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, who requested the subpoena on her behalf.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein as claims administration experts to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein as claims administration experts to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
The Administrator (Feldman) may, at her discretion and with a claimant's consent, consult with Professor Hamilton for expertise on sexual abuse dynamics and victim sensitivities.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to EVCP Administrator
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney issues a subpoena to Jordana Feldman, Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, commanding her to produce documents related to the program and its claimants for the criminal case.

events.title: Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Protocol Established
events.description: The Protocol for the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is finalized, outlining the purpose, administration, eligibility, and claims process for victims-survivors of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
Denver, Colorado 80203 (address of Jeffrey S. Pagliuca's law firm)
Probate Court of the United States Virgin Islands (mentioned for reporting)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all claimant materials, communications, payments, and releases.

The EVCP is a voluntary, independent program administered by Jordana Feldman, designed by experts including Kenneth Feinberg and Camille Biros, with consultation available from sexual abuse expert Marci Hamilton.
The program allows individuals who previously settled with Epstein or whose claims are time-barred to participate, and includes those who allegedly assisted Epstein under duress from their own abuse.

Claimants who accept compensation must sign a release waiving future claims against the Estate and related entities/individuals, but are not bound by confidentiality and may speak freely about their abuse.
The subpoena commands production of documents to the federal court in New York, indicating the defense seeks this information for Maxwell's criminal case (20CR330).
